name: Chang Kim
overview: Chang Kim is currently the product manager of Google's [Blogger](http://blogger.com), the world's leading blogging service. Previously, he was the co-founder / co-CEO of TNC, an Asian blogging service company that was [acquired by Google in 2008](http://www.techmeme.com/080912/h1455). Prior to TNC, he worked at Samsung Mobile. Chang is also one of the mentors for Dave McClure's [500 Startups](http://500startups.com/mentors.php) and is currently an advisor to three Silicon Valley startups. Chang is a frequent speaker at industry events and organized various conferences including [his own](http://openwebasia.com). Chang received a B.S. in Physics from the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor, and also matriculated at Seoul National University in Seoul, Korea. He currently lives in the San Francisco bay area.
